item.title: A resolution expressing support for the designation of Journeyman Lineworkers Recognition Day.

latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S3121; text: CR S2992)

item.title: Expressing support for the designation of July 10th as Journeyman Lineworkers Recognition Day.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

item.title: A resolution expressing support for the designation of July 10, 2024, as Journeyman Lineworkers Recognition Day.

latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S4337; text: CR S4346)

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy, Climate and Grid Security.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

item.fullName: Del. Sablan, Gregorio Kilili Camacho [D-MP-At Large]

cdata.text: This resolution expresses support for the designation of Journeyman Lineworkers Recognition Day. (A journeyman lineworker is a person who builds and maintains electrical power systems.)

bill.title: Expressing support for the designation of Journeyman Lineworkers Recognition Day.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
